2114.subject: PH
2114.descrlong: Provides students with an opportunity to develop an understanding of the dimensions of women's health through a comparative and historical analysis of women's health status throughout the developing world and in the US. Readings and interactive discussion emphasize cross-cultural similarities and differences in women's health and social conditions, and issues related to social justice and health. (Offered every semester)

2132.subject: PH
2132.descrlong: Provides students with an understanding of global public health issues as it relates to the health of women, their children and families. Students conduct comparative research and historical analyses of women's health status in countries of interest in the developing world and in the US. Readings and interactive discussion emphasize cross-cultural similarities and differences in women's health and social conditions, and issues related to social justice and health.  (Credit/ No Credit Available)
